input_text:
Job Title: Senior Business Program Manager SEO - Americas

Location: Seattle, WA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
If you need assistance during the recruiting process due to a disability, please reach out to our Recruiting Accommodations Team through the Accommodation Request form. This form is used only by individuals with disabilities who require assistance or adjustments in applying and interviewing for a job. This form is not for inquiring about a position or the status of an application.

Are you passionate about travel? Do you believe global travel is important for trust, understanding, and empathy among people? At Expedia Group (EG), we are the world’s travel platform, and our purpose is to bring the world within reach. Do you want to become an integral part of a global SEO team delivering results for multiple global brands such as Expedia, Hotels.com, Vrbo. Our team seeks a Senior Business Program Manager to drive change for the next generation of SEO challenges and opportunities in a fast-paced & ever-changing environment. You will work on global, large-scale projects or programs, across various teams and lines of business.

You aspire to achieve a balanced combination of innovative thinking, influence, creativity, and technical direction. You exercise your creativity to orchestrate complex decisions and scenarios. If you enjoy being results-oriented and collaborative, have bias to action, strong project & change management as well as analytics and problem-solving skills then join this dynamic team!

What You'll Do...

Drive complex programs requiring coordination across teams and organizations. Establishes strategy & direction of execution within a program.Scope, design, structure and lead large scale, complex and ambiguous projects and programs. Design and optimize effective project and program structures, organization and governance, throughout the project lifecycle, to set them up for success.Build, empower and lead effective project teams by ensuring clear roles & responsibilities, goals & milestones, and driving accountability throughout the project/program lifecycle. Design tailored plans and frameworks as needed.Provide frameworks, leverage data and fact-based investigation to independently solve ambiguous problems, and drive alignment, prioritization and focus from leadership to project groups. Perform complex data analyses and extract simple insights when needed.Anticipate, assess, and manage dependencies, resourcing, risks and issues through independent and transparent escalation & reporting. Identify and track key measurements for determining the progress, success, and effectiveness of programs.Ensure effective written and verbal communication throughout the project lifecycle. Tailor communications for different audiences and break down complex information into simplified messages to drive decision-making & accountability.Understand Expedia Group and SEO channel overarching strategy and objectives to guide proper prioritization, resolve challenges, and propose best practices and resolution options.Manage a complex matrix of multiple stakeholders, teams, departments, and workstreams. Use influence and establish relationships to become a trusted advisor and partner. Foster collaboration across SEO and Expedia Group teams. Develop close relationships with applicable leadership teams and serve as a change agent with strong credibility and influence in the organization.

Who You Are

Degree educated, with 8+ years of proven experience in leading complex, cross-functional, large-scale business programs and initiatives. Qualified and experienced in using PMP and/or Agile methodologies and frameworks. Travel industry, customer-centric, sales operations experience preferred.Passion for driving business impact & execution of projects and programs through to completion. Self-motivated with a positive, can-do attitude and the ability to drive success with limited guidance in a highly autonomous role.Strong organizational skills, with the ability to develop and optimize robust project governance, framework, plans, and work processes in partnership with cross-functional project teams.Ability to manage key relationships: mobilize, influence, and lead others without having positional authority, by interacting and building rapport with teams of all levels, in a fast-moving and ever-changing environment.Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with strong business acumen, ability to think strategically, and to see the bigger picture without missing details. A keen sense for prioritization and the ability to distinguish the critical from the extraneous factors influencing project outcomes.Excellent communication skills with the ability to simplify and present complex concepts to both executive leadership and operational teams. Inclusive team player with the ability to build an inclusive environment to bring a diverse set of perspectives to the team and our solutions.

The total cash range for this position in Seattle is $155,000 to $217,000. Employees in this role have the potential to increase their pay up to $248,000, which is the top of the range, based on ongoing, demonstrated, and sustained performance in the role.

Starting pay for this role will vary based on multiple factors, including location, available budget, and an individual’s knowledge, skills, and experience. Pay ranges may be modified in the future. Expedia Group is proud to offer a wide range of benefits to support employees and their families, including medical/dental/vision, paid time off, and an Employee Assistance Program.

To fuel each employee’s passion for travel, we offer a wellness & travel reimbursement, travel discounts, and an International Airlines Travel Agent (IATAN) membership. View our full list of benefits.

The total cash range for this position in Seattle is $155,000.00 to $217,000.00. Employees in this role have the potential to increase their pay up to $248,000.00, which is the top of the range, based on ongoing, demonstrated, and sustained performance in the role.

Starting pay for this role will vary based on multiple factors, including location, available budget, and an individual’s knowledge, skills, and experience. Pay ranges may be modified in the future.

Expedia Group is proud to offer a wide range of benefits to support employees and their families, including medical/dental/vision, paid time off, and an Employee Assistance Program. To fuel each employee’s passion for travel, we offer a wellness & travel reimbursement, travel discounts, and an International Airlines Travel Agent (IATAN) membership.View our full list of benefits.

About Expedia Group

Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Driven by the core belief that travel is a force for good, we help people experience the world in new ways and build lasting connections. We provide industry-leading technology solutions to fuel partner growth and success, while facilitating memorable experiences for travelers. Expedia Group's family of brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Vrbo®, trivago®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Hotwire®, Wotif®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Expedia Group™ Media Solutions, Expedia Local Expert®, CarRentals.com™, and Expedia Cruises™.

© 2021 Expedia, Inc. All rights reserved. Trademarks and logos are the property of their respective owners. CST: 2029030-50

Employment opportunities and job offers at Expedia Group will always come from Expedia Group’s Talent Acquisition and hiring teams. Never provide sensitive, personal information to someone unless you’re confident who the recipient is. Expedia Group does not extend job offers via email or any other messaging tools to individuals to whom we have not made prior contact. Our email domain is @expediagroup.com. The official website to find and apply for job openings at Expedia Group is careers.expediagroup.com/jobs.

Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. This employer participates in E-Verify. The employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee's I-9 to confirm work authorization.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
